title: Introduction to Philosophy of Mind
abstract: These lecture notes cover foundational concepts in the philosophy of mind, including the mind-body problem, consciousness, and intentionality. The notes explore key theories such as dualism, materialism, and functionalism.
subject: Philosophy of Mind

title: Modern Cryptography Methods
abstract: A comprehensive overview of modern cryptographic methods including symmetric and asymmetric encryption, hash functions, digital signatures, and key exchange protocols. The notes include mathematical explanations as well as practical applications in computer security.
subject: Computer Science

title: Literary Theory: Structuralism and Post-Structuralism
abstract: These notes explore the development of structuralist and post-structuralist literary theories, focusing on the works of Ferdinand de Saussure, Jacques Derrida, Michel Foucault, and Roland Barthes. The lecture examines how these theoretical frameworks revolutionized textual analysis and cultural critique.
subject: Literary Theory

title: Advanced Quantum Mechanics
abstract: A deep dive into advanced topics in quantum mechanics, including quantum entanglement, quantum information theory, and quantum computing. The notes explore mathematical formalisms as well as experimental evidence for quantum phenomena.
subject: Physics

title: Behavioral Economics: Decision-Making Under Uncertainty
abstract: These lecture notes examine how humans make decisions under uncertainty, with a focus on cognitive biases and heuristics. The material covers prospect theory, loss aversion, framing effects, and other key concepts in behavioral economics.
subject: Economics
